net.joeclark.proceduralgeneration

Class MarkovTextGenerator

  • java.lang.Object
    • net.joeclark.proceduralgeneration.MarkovTextGenerator
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    RandomTextGenerator
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    MarkovTextCasePreservingGenerator

    public class MarkovTextGenerator
extends Object
implements RandomTextGenerator
    A class that uses a Markov model, trained on a Stream<String> of example text, to generate new, random strings similar to the training data. Based on an algorithm described by JLund3 at RogueBasin.

    • Constructor Detail

      • MarkovTextGenerator

        public MarkovTextGenerator()
        Initialize a new MarkovTextGenerator. A new instance begins with the default values for order, prior, minLength, maxLength, startFilter, and endFilter. After initialization, you must train the model on a stream of input Strings before generating names, optionally first setting parameters such as order and prior, e.g.: new MarkovTextGenerator.withOrder(3).withPrior(0.005D),train(streamOfStrings)

        random - a Random number generator to be used in generating text
        Returns:
        the same MarkovTextGenerator

      • withOrder

        public MarkovTextGenerator withOrder(int order)
        Parameters:
        order - the "order" of the model (default 3). higher orders are more sophisticated but slower to train, with diminishing returns
        Returns:
        the same MarkovTextGenerator

      • withPrior

        public MarkovTextGenerator withPrior(double prior)
        Parameters:
        prior - a Bayesian prior that injects some true randomness (default 0.005). increase it to make your text more random or to make up for sparse training data
        Returns:
        the same MarkovTextGenerator

        public MarkovTextGenerator withStartFilter(String startFilter)
        Parameters:

        Returns:
        the same MarkovTextGenerator

      • isTrained

        public boolean isTrained()
        Returns:
        true if the model was trained. Don't attempt to generate names from an untrained model, or you'll get an InvalidStateException!

      • train

        public MarkovTextGenerator train(Stream<String> rawWords)
        Build the Markov chain model based on a training dataset. Do this after setting the desired order and prior, but before attempting to generate names. If this function is called a second time, it will add new observations to the existing model. This can be used to create "blended" models.
        Parameters:
        rawWords - a Stream of training data, e.g. from a file. your random text output will look like the input data
        Returns:
        the same MarkovTextGenerator

      • makeObservations

        protected void makeObservations(Stream<String> rawWords)

        protected void buildModelFromObservations()

      • generateOne

        public String generateOne()
        Description copied from interface: RandomTextGenerator
        Generate a random text string, using the implementation's default configuration.
        Specified by:
        generateOne in interface RandomTextGenerator
        Returns:
        a random string that based on a Markov chain model that is likely to be original but similar to the strings in the training data. If you have set filters such as maximum and minimum length, or a starting and ending sequence, be careful that those filters are not impossible given the training data (for example, the instance infers an alphabet from the training data and will never generate letters outside that alphabet). You could end up with an infinite loop or an exception if your filters are impossible to match.
        Throws:
        IllegalStateException - if model has not been trained
